trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Service Bus with the WebJobs SDK
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Service Bus with the WebJobs SDK

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Service Bus queues and topics with the WebJobs SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Service Bus queues and topics with the WebJobs SDK.

trans-unit.source: This guide provides C# code samples that show how to trigger a process when an Azure blob is created or updated.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides C# code samples that show how to trigger a process when an Azure blob is created or updated.

trans-unit.source: The code samples use <linkText>WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title> version 1.x.
trans-unit.target: The code samples use <linkText>WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title> version 1.x.

trans-unit.source: The guide assumes you know <linkText>how to create a WebJob project in Visual Studio with connection strings that point to your storage account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The guide assumes you know <linkText>how to create a WebJob project in Visual Studio with connection strings that point to your storage account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The code snippets only show functions, not the code that creates the JobHost object as in this example:
trans-unit.target: The code snippets only show functions, not the code that creates the JobHost object as in this example:

trans-unit.source: To work with Service Bus you have to install the <linkText>Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus</linkText><title></title> NuGet package in addition to the other WebJobs SDK packages.
trans-unit.target: To work with Service Bus you have to install the <linkText>Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus</linkText><title></title> NuGet package in addition to the other WebJobs SDK packages.

trans-unit.source: You also have to set the AzureWebJobsServiceBus connection string in addition to the storage connection strings.
trans-unit.target: You also have to set the AzureWebJobsServiceBus connection string in addition to the storage connection strings.

trans-unit.source: You can do this in the connectionStrings section of the App.config file, as shown in the following example:
trans-unit.target: You can do this in the connectionStrings section of the App.config file, as shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: For a sample project that includes the Service Bus connection string setting in the App.config file, see <linkText>Service Bus example</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a sample project that includes the Service Bus connection string setting in the App.config file, see <linkText>Service Bus example</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The connection strings can also be set in the Azure runtime environment, which then overrides the App.config settings when the WebJob runs in Azure; for more information, see <linkText>Get Started with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The connection strings can also be set in the Azure runtime environment, which then overrides the App.config settings when the WebJob runs in Azure; for more information, see <linkText>Get Started with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To write a function that the WebJobs SDK calls when a queue message is received, use the ServiceBusTrigger attribute.
trans-unit.target: To write a function that the WebJobs SDK calls when a queue message is received, use the ServiceBusTrigger attribute.

trans-unit.source: The attribute constructor takes a parameter that specifies the name of the queue to poll.
trans-unit.target: The attribute constructor takes a parameter that specifies the name of the queue to poll.

trans-unit.source: The SDK receives a message in PeekLock mode and calls Complete on the message if the function finishes successfully, or calls Abandon if the function fails.
trans-unit.target: The SDK receives a message in PeekLock mode and calls Complete on the message if the function finishes successfully, or calls Abandon if the function fails.

trans-unit.source: If the function runs longer than the PeekLock timeout, the lock is automatically renewed.
trans-unit.target: If the function runs longer than the PeekLock timeout, the lock is automatically renewed.

trans-unit.source: Serice Bus does its own poison queue handling, so that is neither controlled by, nor configurable in, the WebJobs SDK.
trans-unit.target: Serice Bus does its own poison queue handling, so that is neither controlled by, nor configurable in, the WebJobs SDK.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample reads a queue message that contains a string and writes the string to the WebJobs SDK dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample reads a queue message that contains a string and writes the string to the WebJobs SDK dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Note: If you are creating the queue messages in an application that doesn't use the WebJobs SDK, make sure to set BrokeredMessage.ContentType to "text/plain".
trans-unit.target: Note: If you are creating the queue messages in an application that doesn't use the WebJobs SDK, make sure to set BrokeredMessage.ContentType to "text/plain".

trans-unit.source: The SDK will automatically deserialize a queue message that contains JSON for a POCO [(Plain Old CLR Object](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PlainOldCLR_Object)) type.
trans-unit.target: The SDK will automatically deserialize a queue message that contains JSON for a POCO [(Plain Old CLR Object](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PlainOldCLR_Object)) type.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample reads a queue message that contains a BlobInformation object which has a BlobName property:
trans-unit.target: The following code sample reads a queue message that contains a BlobInformation object which has a BlobName property:

trans-unit.source: For code samples showing how to use properties of the POCO to work with blobs and tables in the same function, see the <linkText>storage queues version of this article</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For code samples showing how to use properties of the POCO to work with blobs and tables in the same function, see the <linkText>storage queues version of this article</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If your code that creates the queue message doesn't use the WebJobs SDK, use code similar to the following example:
trans-unit.target: If your code that creates the queue message doesn't use the WebJobs SDK, use code similar to the following example:

trans-unit.source: Besides string and POCO types, you can use the ServiceBusTrigger attribute with a byte array or a BrokeredMessage object.
trans-unit.target: Besides string and POCO types, you can use the ServiceBusTrigger attribute with a byte array or a BrokeredMessage object.

trans-unit.source: To write a function that creates a new queue message use the ServiceBus attribute and pass in the queue name to the attribute constructor.
trans-unit.target: To write a function that creates a new queue message use the ServiceBus attribute and pass in the queue name to the attribute constructor.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample uses an output parameter to create a new message in the queue named "outputqueue" with the same content as the message received in the queue named "inputqueue".
trans-unit.target: The following code sample uses an output parameter to create a new message in the queue named "outputqueue" with the same content as the message received in the queue named "inputqueue".

trans-unit.source: The output parameter for creating a single queue message can be any of the following types:
trans-unit.target: The output parameter for creating a single queue message can be any of the following types:

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: byte[]
trans-unit.target: byte[]

trans-unit.source: BrokeredMessage
trans-unit.target: BrokeredMessage

trans-unit.source: A serializable POCO type that you define.
trans-unit.target: A serializable POCO type that you define.

trans-unit.source: Automatically serialized as JSON.
trans-unit.target: Automatically serialized as JSON.

trans-unit.source: For POCO type parameters, a queue message is always created when the function ends; if the parameter is null, the SDK creates a queue message that will return null when the message is received and deserialized.
trans-unit.target: For POCO type parameters, a queue message is always created when the function ends; if the parameter is null, the SDK creates a queue message that will return null when the message is received and deserialized.

trans-unit.source: For the other types, if the parameter is null no queue message is created.
trans-unit.target: For the other types, if the parameter is null no queue message is created.

trans-unit.source: To create multiple messages, use the ServiceBus attribute with ICollector or IAsyncCollector, as shown in the following code sample:
trans-unit.target: To create multiple messages, use the ServiceBus attribute with ICollector or IAsyncCollector, as shown in the following code sample:

trans-unit.source: Each queue message is created immediately when the Add method is called.
trans-unit.target: Each queue message is created immediately when the Add method is called.

trans-unit.source: To write a function that the SDK calls when a message is received on a Service Bus topic, use the ServiceBusTrigger attribute with the constructor that takes topic name and subscription name, as shown in the following code sample:
trans-unit.target: To write a function that the SDK calls when a message is received on a Service Bus topic, use the ServiceBusTrigger attribute with the constructor that takes topic name and subscription name, as shown in the following code sample:

trans-unit.source: To create a message on a topic, use the ServiceBus attribute with a topic name the same way you use it with a queue name.
trans-unit.target: To create a message on a topic, use the ServiceBus attribute with a topic name the same way you use it with a queue name.

trans-unit.source: For information about WebJobs SDK scenarios not specific to Service Bus, see <linkText>How to use Azure queue storage with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about WebJobs SDK scenarios not specific to Service Bus, see <linkText>How to use Azure queue storage with the WebJobs SDK</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: Use WebJobs SDK attributes in the body of a function

trans-unit.target: Set the SDK connection strings in code

trans-unit.source: This guide has provided code samples that show how to handle common scenarios for working with Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: This guide has provided code samples that show how to handle common scenarios for working with Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to use Azure WebJobs and the WebJobs SDK, see <linkText>Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to use Azure WebJobs and the WebJobs SDK, see <linkText>Azure WebJobs Recommended Resources</linkText><title></title>.
